Message.Title: It's on Ebay not Amazon
Message.Msg: Those really hard to find items eventually show up on Ebay but never on Amazon

You're right John. However, eBay is too stupid about that fact, and pushes the New Items agenda. Amazon is king when it comes to New items. eBay will forever be in Amazon's shadow in that respect. Ebay has a goldmine right under their feet, but walks right over it. This is why Amazon continues to grow while everyone else stalls or falls.

Ebay makes BIG BIG profits while Amazon continues to LOSE BIG BIG money Amazons house of cards will crumble someday Amazons a Wall Street Shell Game Jeff Bezos is too busy looking for old Apollo rocket engines, I think he's gone nUtS
Really? You don't say!

Bezos is interested in growing Amazon. Ebay continues to play the shell game with their fee structures and stock. It's obvious Amazon is the better company, overall. Sure, they might be slightly overvalued, but smart people recognize what they are trying to accomplish. Don't get me wrong, I don't think Amazon is the end-all/be-all company, but it is eBay who continues to compare themselves to them, instead of just being the great company it could be. John Donahoe is not the least bit interested in growing the company for the future, he is only interested in right now (no matter what he says, he's full of it). This is what you get with Bain spawn.

I admit I'm confused on Donahoe's thinking on what Ebay should be I myself think he's moving in the WRONG direction with the company but I'm not college educated like he is. I'm only a poor Ebay seller. . .

Also an eBay seller! This is the trouble - eBay continues to struggle with it's core business, they have an identity crisis going on. Amazon is on auto-pilot in regard to their core business. Investors recognize this, and continue to go with them. If one is in the fast money game, eBay is the ideal choice. For a long term, Amazon wins, hands down. However, eBay could (and SHOULD) be king at what they do, but are short-sighted. Paypal is the only thing saving eBay.
